item.description:
Radical idealism as an approach to the mind body problem seems as palatable as swallowing rocks. It makes some people want to kick rocks. Nevertheless, I (and anyone who wants to join this meeting's 'A' Team) will try to defend a version of it in what I think is a surprising and novel way. If I can make it, I'll try to post the power point ahead of time, but I can't promise.

As per our normal drill:
- Come striaght up to the 5th floor conference room.
- IF the door is locked, my mobile is 857-928-3181
- Due to seating capacity, attendance is limited to 12.
- (Discretely) bring your own beer, wine, etc. and
- Let me know if you're taking part in the pizza pool.

See you there
Sean
item.how_to_find_us: Beige colored building on the corner--1block from Kenmore Sq

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: Swallowing radical idealism?... only with a lot of beer...
